page.title: 16HOUSES IN ROGERSTONE-1
page.content: Most houses built before 1900 are to be found in the rural area.They are mainly farmhouses and small cottages built by Lord Tredegar for estate workers.There are,however,still some late 19th century terraced houses at Rogerstone built for industrial workers. The early 20th century houses are brick villas,council houses and semi- detached and detached houses lining the main roads. The most recent developments have been estates at Rogerstone,Bassaleg and Rhiwderin.Estate agents told us that most of the houses for sale in our block were on estates. Prices varied from 15,000 for a very small house with a bed-sitting room,kitchenette and shower room to 70,000 for a 4-bedroomed detached house with double garage.
